Claim: The Chinese supreme court OK’d euthanasia for 20,000 people.
Explaination: The article was published on a site that has regularly produced hoax reports, and China has made no such announcement.
Label: False
html:
Claim: The Chinese supreme court OK’d euthanasia for 20,000 people.

Explanation:The article was published on a site that has regularly produced hoax reports, and China has made no such announcement.

http://u.afp.com/CoronavirusHoax

Claim: Italy official Giulio Gallera: China lies to us. The date China provided is false. Italy has become Wuhan and the medical system has a breakdown.
Explaination: The Health and Welfare Regional Minister in Lombardy, Giulio Gallera, didn't give such statements in the interview.
Label: Partially false
html:
Claim: Italy official Giulio Gallera: China lies to us. The date China provided is false. Italy has become Wuhan and the medical system has a breakdown.

Explanation:The Health and Welfare Regional Minister in Lombardy, Giulio Gallera, didn't give such statements in the interview.

https://tfc-taiwan.org.tw/articles/3162

Claim: A post with a photo claiming that an Italian mother, suffering from COVID-19, hugs her baby
Explaination: The viral image is an old image, The mother is suffering from cancer and was clicked post her radiotherapy when she could not hug her child.
Label: False
html:
Claim: A post with a photo claiming that an Italian mother, suffering from COVID-19, hugs her baby

Explanation:The viral image is an old image, The mother is suffering from cancer and was clicked post her radiotherapy when she could not hug her child.

https://myanmar.factcrescendo.com/fact-check-post-with-a-photo-claiming-that-an-italian-mother-suffering-covid-19-infection-hugs-her-baby/

Claim: WHO offers free data for coronavirus info.
Explaination: Links in post lead to external website, potentially with harmful malware. Post is false, clickbait.
Label: False
html:
Claim: WHO offers free data for coronavirus info.

Explanation:Links in post lead to external website, potentially with harmful malware. Post is false, clickbait.

https://africacheck.org/fbcheck/no-who-not-offering-free-data-for-coronavirus-info/

Claim: 3,000 Ecuadorians are infected with coronavirus.
Explaination: Please click the link to read the full article
Label: False
html:
Claim: 3,000 Ecuadorians are infected with coronavirus.

Explanation:Please click the link to read the full article

http://www.ecuadorchequea.com/las-mentiras-sobre-el-covid-19-en-ecuador/?check=25

Claim: Rainbow shimmers behind a COVID-19 disinfectant truck in China.
Explaination: It's from March 2019.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Rainbow shimmers behind a COVID-19 disinfectant truck in China.

Explanation:It's from March 2019.

https://factcheck.afp.com/video-has-circulated-online-least-march-2019-months-novel-coronavirus-outbreak

Claim: Flu vaccine increases coronavirus risk 36%, says military study.
Explaination: More research is needed to provide a conclusive answer to the question of whether the flu shot increases the risk of non-influenza viral respiratory infections. It is important to keep in mind that while the flu vaccine cannot prevent COVID-19, it still provides several indirect benefits. For example, it reduces cases of flu and flu complications that require hospitalization, in turn reducing the burden on the healthcare system, which has become strained during the COVID-19 pandemic.
Label: No evidence
html:
Claim: Flu vaccine increases coronavirus risk 36%, says military study.

Explanation:More research is needed to provide a conclusive answer to the question of whether the flu shot increases the risk of non-influenza viral respiratory infections. It is important to keep in mind that while the flu vaccine cannot prevent COVID-19, it still provides several indirect benefits. For example, it reduces cases of flu and flu complications that require hospitalization, in turn reducing the burden on the healthcare system, which has become strained during the COVID-19 pandemic.

https://healthfeedback.org/claimreview/claim-that-flu-vaccine-increases-coronavirus-infection-is-unsupported-misinterprets-scientific-studies/

Claim: A video has been viewed thousands of times in Facebook posts alongside a claim it shows a Sri Lankan doctor who invented a rapid test kit for the novel coronavirus, which causes the disease COVID-19.
Explaination: The claim is false; the doctor seen in the video was being interviewed by an Australian television channel to discuss the benefits of rapid COVID-19 testing; the doctor told AFP he was not involved in the development of testing kits.
Label: False
html:
Claim: A video has been viewed thousands of times in Facebook posts alongside a claim it shows a Sri Lankan doctor who invented a rapid test kit for the novel coronavirus, which causes the disease COVID-19.

Explanation:The claim is false; the doctor seen in the video was being interviewed by an Australian television channel to discuss the benefits of rapid COVID-19 testing; the doctor told AFP he was not involved in the development of testing kits.

https://factcheck.afp.com/doctor-interviewed-report-did-not-say-he-was-involved-development-covid-19-test-kits

Claim: Drinking lots of water and gargling with warm water and salt or vinegar eliminates the novel coronavirus. Spread the information as you can save someone.
Explaination: According to GMA news report, saline gargles or gargling with water and salt will provide no protection against or cure for the 2019 novel coronavirus acute respiratory disease (2019-nCoV ARD). The report also carried a statement by the Dr. Eric Domingo “I think this is a home remedy that has been followed for many, many generations and I don't think there’s going to be any harm in doing it. Saline gargle has always been advocated to improve mostly symptoms of sore throat...I don't think there is any evidence that it will kill a virus,” Domingo said.
Label: Misleading
html:
Claim: Drinking lots of water and gargling with warm water and salt or vinegar eliminates the novel coronavirus. Spread the information as you can save someone.

Explanation:According to GMA news report, saline gargles or gargling with water and salt will provide no protection against or cure for the 2019 novel coronavirus acute respiratory disease (2019-nCoV ARD). The report also carried a statement by the Dr. Eric Domingo “I think this is a home remedy that has been followed for many, many generations and I don't think there’s going to be any harm in doing it. Saline gargle has always been advocated to improve mostly symptoms of sore throat...I don't think there is any evidence that it will kill a virus,” Domingo said.

https://www.newschecker.in/article/news-detail/275_15211727

Claim: The Asterix comic books and The Simpsons predicted the coronavirus outbreak.
Explaination: Coronavirus has been around since the 1960s while the Simpsons picture was edited.
Label: Misleading
html:
Claim: The Asterix comic books and The Simpsons predicted the coronavirus outbreak.

Explanation:Coronavirus has been around since the 1960s while the Simpsons picture was edited.

https://www.boomlive.in/health/did-the-simpsons-and-comic-series-asterix-predict-the-2019-coronavirus-outbreak-6867

Claim: The claim that there is a cure from the new coronavirus. The name of the drug is decametoxine.
Explaination: There is no proof that the drug in question can be used in the treatment of coronavirus-infected.
Label: False
html:
Claim: The claim that there is a cure from the new coronavirus. The name of the drug is decametoxine.

Explanation:There is no proof that the drug in question can be used in the treatment of coronavirus-infected.

https://t.me/voxcheck/365

Claim: An audio clip of Dr. Naresh Trehan cautioning people about the danger of COVID-19 in India.
Explaination: The audio is not of Dr. Trehan, nor has he ever said what is said in this audio recording.
Label: False
html:
Claim: An audio clip of Dr. Naresh Trehan cautioning people about the danger of COVID-19 in India.

Explanation:The audio is not of Dr. Trehan, nor has he ever said what is said in this audio recording.

https://aajtak.intoday.in/story/fact-check-dr-naresh-trehan-coronavirus-covid-19-social-media-viral-post-1-1176172.html

Claim: 10,000 deaths In virus outbreak in Michigan, Washington, Idaho, North Dakota, Missouri, Mississippi.
Explaination: The CDC counted 25 deaths and 647 confirmed coronavirus cases in the United States as of March 10, 2020.
Label: False
html:
Claim: 10,000 deaths In virus outbreak in Michigan, Washington, Idaho, North Dakota, Missouri, Mississippi.

Explanation:The CDC counted 25 deaths and 647 confirmed coronavirus cases in the United States as of March 10, 2020.

https://hoax-alert.leadstories.com/3471877-fact-check-not-10000-deaths-in-virus-outbreak-in-michigan-washington-idaho-north-dakota-mississippi.html

Claim: A video of police arresting a man has been viewed thousands of times on Facebook and Twitter alongside a claim it shows police in Italy detaining a man who flouted a national lockdown during the novel coronavirus pandemic.
Explaination: The claim is false; the footage in fact shows police arresting a knife-wielding man in the Brazilian city of Sao Paulo.
Label: False
html:
Claim: A video of police arresting a man has been viewed thousands of times on Facebook and Twitter alongside a claim it shows police in Italy detaining a man who flouted a national lockdown during the novel coronavirus pandemic.

Explanation:The claim is false; the footage in fact shows police arresting a knife-wielding man in the Brazilian city of Sao Paulo.

https://factcheck.afp.com/video-shows-police-arresting-knife-wielding-man-brazil

Claim: The WHO offered the testing kits that they have available and to give it to us now. We refused them. We did not want to buy them.”
Explaination: The WHO never offered to sell test kits to the United States. The CDC opted to develop its own coronavirus test and did not use the WHO’s protocol for the test.
Label: Mostly false
html:
Claim: The WHO offered the testing kits that they have available and to give it to us now. We refused them. We did not want to buy them.”

Explanation:The WHO never offered to sell test kits to the United States. The CDC opted to develop its own coronavirus test and did not use the WHO’s protocol for the test.

https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2020/mar/16/joe-biden/biden-falsely-says-trump-administration-rejected-w/

Claim: Russian President Putin released 500 lions onto the streets to keep people indoors.
Explaination: The screen grab in the post was taken from a movie, not a real news report.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Russian President Putin released 500 lions onto the streets to keep people indoors.

Explanation:The screen grab in the post was taken from a movie, not a real news report.

https://leadstories.com/hoax-alert/2020/03/Fact-Check-Russia's-Putin-Did-NOT-Release-500-Lions-To-Keep-People-Indoors-Amid-Coronavirus.html

Claim: Chart compares COVID-19 with other longstanding diseases.
Explaination: The graphic is misleading and risks underplaying the danger of the novel coronavirus, COVID-19, which is a new disease with a fast-rising mortality rate.
Label: Misleading
html:
Claim: Chart compares COVID-19 with other longstanding diseases.

Explanation:The graphic is misleading and risks underplaying the danger of the novel coronavirus, COVID-19, which is a new disease with a fast-rising mortality rate.

https://factcheck.afp.com/health-experts-say-comparing-death-tolls-emerging-epidemic-longstanding-diseases-risks-underplaying

Claim: Vaccines to cure COVID-19 are ready.
Explaination: Viral image is of a COVID-19 testing kit. A cure is still being researched.
Label: Mostly false
html:
Claim: Vaccines to cure COVID-19 are ready.

Explanation:Viral image is of a COVID-19 testing kit. A cure is still being researched.

https://www.indiatoday.in/fact-check/story/covid-19-testing-kit-fact-check-coronavirus-1658750-2020-03-23

Claim: Israel has no deaths from COVID-19; tea made of lemon and bicarbonate can cure coronavirus.
Explaination: The post claiming Israel has no deaths from COVID-19 is false. And, hot tea made of lemon and bicarbonate is no cure for novel coronavirus.
Label: FALSE
html:
Claim: Israel has no deaths from COVID-19; tea made of lemon and bicarbonate can cure coronavirus.

Explanation:The post claiming Israel has no deaths from COVID-19 is false. And, hot tea made of lemon and bicarbonate is no cure for novel coronavirus.

https://www.vishvasnews.com/english/health/fact-check-post-claiming-israel-has-no-deaths-from-covid-19-is-false-tea-made-of-lemon-and-bicarbonate-is-no-cure-for-coronavirus/

Claim: Rubbing mustard oil on your nostrils can prevent coronavirus.
Explaination: Rubbing mustard oil cannot prevent coronavirus.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Rubbing mustard oil on your nostrils can prevent coronavirus.

Explanation:Rubbing mustard oil cannot prevent coronavirus.

Explaination: The picture is indeed from Italy but is seven years old and has nothing to do with the coronavirus outbreak.
Label: Misleading
html:
Claim: Photo of coffins of coronavirus patients who died in a single day in Italy.

Explanation:The picture is indeed from Italy but is seven years old and has nothing to do with the coronavirus outbreak.

Explaination: The quote was pulled out of context and was mere speculation, not fact.
Label: False

Explanation:The quote was pulled out of context and was mere speculation, not fact.

Claim: Dead bodies of coronavirus patients are being discarded in mass graves in Italy, according to a 23-second video clip that has gone viral on social media.
Explaination: The video clip was from the US miniseries Pandemic released in 2007.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Dead bodies of coronavirus patients are being discarded in mass graves in Italy, according to a 23-second video clip that has gone viral on social media.

Explanation:The video clip was from the US miniseries Pandemic released in 2007.

https://www.rappler.com/newsbreak/fact-check/256810-video-clip-dead-bodies-coronavirus-patients-italy

Claim: “The Chinese Communist Party is using Zoom as a way to spy on our citizens.”
Explaination: The claim is based on a report from researchers at the University of Toronto. But one of the researchers told us that while they identified security issues with Zoom, whether China has exploited the platform for espionage was not something they considered.
Label: Mostly false
html:
Claim: “The Chinese Communist Party is using Zoom as a way to spy on our citizens.”

Explanation:The claim is based on a report from researchers at the University of Toronto. But one of the researchers told us that while they identified security issues with Zoom, whether China has exploited the platform for espionage was not something they considered.

https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2020/apr/07/charlie-kirk/china-spying-you-through-zoom-charlie-kirk-oversta/

Explaination: The quote attributed to Italian PM is made up.
Label: False
html:
